article.paragraph: Chrysler(IPAc-enˈkraɪslər), officiallyFCA US LLC, is an Americanautomobile manufacturerheadquartered inAuburn Hills, Michiganand owned by holding companyFiat Chrysler Automobiles, headquartered inLondon, U.K.cite webhttp://www.autonews.com/article/20140121/OEM/140129980/fiat-completes-chrysler-acquisition-in-4-35-billion-deal#axzz2r8024er1Fiat completes Chrysler acquisition in $4.35 billion dealAutonews.comJanuary 21, 2014April 1, 2014Chrysler is one of the "Big Three (automobile manufacturers)Big Three" American automobile manufacturers. It sells vehicles worldwide under its flagshipChrysler (division)Chryslerbrand, as well as theDodge,JeepandRam TrucksRam. Other major divisions includeMopar, its automotive parts and accessories division, andStreet & Racing TechnologySRT, its performance automobile division. In 2014, FCA US LLC is theAutomotive industry#By manufacturerseventh biggestautomaker in the world by production.cite webhttp://oica.net/wp-content/uploads/ranking.pdfWorld motor vehicle production OICA correspondents survey without double counts world ranking of manufacturers year 2011

The Chrysler Corporation was founded byWalter Chryslerin 1925,cite webhttp://www.jbcarpages.com/chrysler/Chrysler Reviews and HistoryJB car pagesSeptember 22, 2008out of what remained of theMaxwell automobileMaxwell Motor Company. Chrysler greatly expanded in 1928, when it acquired theFargo TrucksFargotruck company and theDodgeDodge Brothers Companyand began selling vehicles under those brands; that same year it also established thePlymouth (automobile)PlymouthandDeSoto (automobile)DeSotoautomobile brands.

In the 1960s the company expanded into Europe, creating theChrysler Europedivision, formed from the acquisition of French, British and Spanish companies. In the 1970s, a number of factors including the1973 oil crisisimpacted Chrysler's sales, and by the late 1970s, Chrysler was on the verge of bankruptcy, forcing its retreat from Europe in 1979.Lee Iacoccawas brought in as CEO and is credited with returning the company to profitability in the 1980s. In 1987, Chrysler acquiredAmerican MotorsAmerican Motors Corporation(AMC), which brought the profitable Jeep brand under the Chrysler umbrella.

In 1998, Chrysler merged with German automakerDaimler-BenzDaimler-Benz AGto form DaimlerChrysler; the merger proved contentious with investors and Chrysler was sold toCerberus Capital Managementand renamed Chrysler LLC in 2007. Like the other Big Three automobile manufacturers, Chrysler was hit hard by theautomotive industry crisis of 20082010.

Through a combination of negotiations with creditors, filing forChrysler Chapter 11 reorganizationChapter 11 bankruptcy reorganizationon April 30, 2009, and participating in a bailout from the U.S. government through theTroubled Asset Relief Program, Chrysler managed to remain in business. On June 10, 2009, Chrysler emerged from the bankruptcy proceedings with theUnited Auto Workerspension fund,Fiat S.p.A., and the U.S. and Canadian governments as principal owners. The bankruptcy resulted in Chrysler defaulting on over $4 billion in debts. By May 24, 2011, Chrysler finished repaying its obligations to the U.S. government five years early, although the cost to the American taxpayer was $1.3 billion. Over the next few years Fiat gradually acquired the other parties' shares while removing much of the weight of the loans (which carried a 21% interest rate) in a short period. On January 1, 2014, Fiat S.p.A announced a deal to purchase the rest of Chrysler from the United Auto Workers retiree health trust. The deal was completed on January 21, 2014, making Chrysler Group a subsidiary of Fiat S.p.A.In May 2014,Fiat Chrysler AutomobilesFiat Chrysler Automobiles, NVwas born by merging Fiat S.p.A. into the company. This was completed in August 2014. Chrysler Group LLC remained a subsidiary until December 15, 2014, when it was renamed FCA US LLC, to reflect the Fiat-Chrysler merger.cite webChrysler Group LLC is now FCA US LLC.http://www.fcausllc.com/Pages/Home.aspxfcausllc.com13 January 2015
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: The Chrysler company was founded byWalter Chrysler(18751940) on June 6, 1925,cite bookDavisMikeTellDavidThe Technology Century: 100 years of The Engineering Society 1895–1995Engineering Society of Detroit199553978-1-56378-022-6cite webLockwoodCliffhttp://www.chryslerclub.org/walterp.htmlEarly Chrysler Corporate History: 1903–1928October 18, 1968Chrysler Club pagesApril 30, 2012when theMaxwell automobileMaxwell Motor Company(est. 1904) was re-organized into the Chrysler Corporation.cite webhttp://www.chryslerclub.org/walterp.htmlA Brief Look at Walter P. ChryslerWPC NewsApril 30, 2012cite bookMalisCarolMichigan: celebrating a century of successCherbo Publishing Group199976978-1-882933-23-5

Walter Chrysler arrived at the ailing Maxwell-Chalmers AutomobileChalmerscompany in the early 1920s. He was hired to overhaul the company's troubled operations (after a similar rescue job at theWillys-Overland car company).cite bookKimesBeverly R.Clark, Jr.Henry A.Standard Catalog of American Cars 1805–19421996Krause Publications978-0-87341-428-9292In late 1923 production of the Chalmers automobile was ended.Kimes, p. 257.

In January 1924, Walter Chrysler launched the well-received Chrysler automobile. The Chrysler was a 6-cylinder automobile, designed to provide customers with an advanced, well-engineered car, but at a more affordable price than they might expect. (Elements of this car are traceable to aprototypewhich had been under development at Willys during Chrysler's tenure).Kimes, pp. 292, 1498.The original 1924 Chrysler included a carburetor air filter, high compression engine, full pressure lubrication, and an oil filter, features absent from most autos at the time.cite webZatzDavidChrysler Technological Innovationshttp://www.allpar.com/corporate/technology.htmlApril 30, 2012cite newsYostMarkA Nation of DriversThe Wall Street Journalhttp://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052970204573704577187152424740014.htmlJanuary 31, 2012D5April 30, 2012Among the innovations in its early years were the first practical mass-produced four-wheel hydraulic brakes, a system nearly completely engineered by Chrysler with patents assigned toLockheed CorporationLockheed, and rubber engine mounts to reduce vibration.Chrysler also developed a wheel with a ridged rim, designed to keep a deflated tire from flying off the wheel. This wheel was eventually adopted by the auto industry worldwide.

Following the introduction of the Chrysler, the Maxwell brand was dropped after the 1925 model year. The new, lower-priced four-cylinder Chryslers introduced for the 1926 year werebadge-engineeringbadge-engineeredMaxwells.Kimes, pp. 292293, 901The advanced engineering and testing that went into Chrysler Corporation cars helped to push the company to the second-place position in U.S. sales by 1936, a position it would last hold in 1949.

In 1928, the Chrysler Corporation began dividing its vehicle offerings by price class and function. ThePlymouth (automobile)Plymouthbrand was introduced at the low-priced end of the market (created essentially by once again reworking and rebadging Chrysler's four-cylinder model).Kimes, pp. 296, 1156.At the same time, theDeSoto (automobile)DeSotobrand was introduced in the medium-price field. Also in 1928, Chrysler bought the Dodge Brotherscite webhttp://www.timelessrides.com/wiki/dodgeDodge Car History, Car Data, Information, PicturesTimeless RidesApril 30, 2012yeshttps://web.archive.org/20120408194842/http://www.timelessrides.com:80/wiki/dodge8 April 2012automobile and truck company and continued the successfulDodgeline of automobiles and Fargo range of trucks. By the mid-1930s, the DeSoto and Dodge divisions would trade places in the corporate hierarchy.

File:Chrysler Imperial car-1955.JPGthumb1955 Imperial car model shown on display at January 1955 Chicago Auto ShowTheImperial (automobile)Imperialname had been used since 1926, but was never a separate make, just the top-of-the-line Chrysler. In 1955, the company decided to spin it off as its own make and division to better compete with its rivals, Lincoln and Cadillac.

article.paragraph: On April 28, 1955, Chrysler andPhilcohad announced the development and production of the Worlds First All-Transistor car radio.cite newsChrysler Promises Car Radio With Transistors Instead of Tubes in '56The Wall Street JournalApril 28, 19551The all-transistor car radio Mopar model 914HR, was developed and produced by Chrysler and Philco, and was an $150.00 "option" on the 1956 Imperial car models. Philco was the company, who had manufactured the all-transistor car radio Mopar model 914HR, starting in the fall of 1955 at its Sandusky Ohio plant, for the Chrysler corporation.cite webHirshRickhttp://www.allpar.com/stereo/Philco/index.htmlPhilco's All-Transistor Mopar Car RadioAllpar.comJanuary 2, 2014cite webhttp://www.radiomuseum.org/r/philco_mopar_914_hr_ch_c_5690hr.htmlMopar 914-HR ChGermanRadiomuseum.orgJanuary 2, 2014cite webhttp://www.chryslergroupllc.com/company/Heritage/Pages/Chrysler-Heritage-1950.aspxChrysler Heritage 1950-1959Chrysler Group LLCApril 1, 2014

On September 28, 1957, Chrysler had announced the first production electronic fuel injection (EFI), as an option on some of its new 1958 car models (Chrysler 300D, Dodge D500, DeSoto Adventurer, Plymouth Fury). The first attempt to use this system was byAmerican Motorson the 1957Rambler Rebel.cite journalWaltonHarryHow Good is Fuel Injection?Popular ScienceMarch 1957170388–93http://books.google.com/books?idJune 24, 2013cite webhttp://auto.howstuffworks.com/1957-1960-rambler-rebel2.htmRambler Measures UpAuto Editors of ''Consumer Guide''September 22, 2007June 24, 2013Bendix Corporation's Electrojector used a transistor computer brain modulator box, but teething problems onpre-production carsmeant very few cars were made.cite bookAirdForbesBosch fuel injection systemsHP Trade200129978-1-55788-365-0The EFI system in the Rambler ran fine in warm weather, but suffered hard starting in cooler temperatures and AMC decided not to use this EFI system, on its 1957 Rambler Rebel production cars that were sold to the public.Chrysler also used the Bendix "Electrojector" fuel injection system and only around 35 vehicles were built with this option, on its 1958 production built car models.cite newsChicago Daily TribuneSeptember 29, 1957A9New Chrysler Fuel System Is Introducedcite webhttp://www.allpar.com/cars/desoto/electrojector.htmlAllpar.com1958 DeSoto Electrojector - World’s First Electronic Fuel Injection?GeorgeMattar29 July 2013Owners of EFI Chryslers were so dissatisfied that all but one were retrofitted with carburetors (while that one has been completely restored, with original EFI electronic problems resolved).

Imperial would see new body styles introduced every two to three years, all with V8 engines and automatic transmissions, as well as technologies that would filter down to Chrysler corporation's other models. Imperial was folded back into the Chrysler brand in 1973.

ThePlymouth ValiantValiantwas also introduced for 1960 as a distinct brand. In the U.S. market, Valiant was made a model in the Plymouth line for 1961 and the DeSoto make was discontinued during 1961. With those exceptions per applicable year and market, Chrysler's range from lowest to highest price from the 1940s through the 1970s was Valiant, Plymouth, Dodge, DeSoto, Chrysler, and Imperial.cite webChrysler Brands, Subsidiaries, and Related CompaniesAllparhttp://www.allpar.com/cars/autoApril 28, 2012

File:Tombstone (financial industry) ad - Chrysler buys AMC 13 August 1987.jpgthumbrightIn 1987 Chrysler purchasedAmerican MotorsfromRenaultIn 1985, Chrysler entered an agreement withAmerican MotorsAmerican Motors Corporation(AMC) to produceChrysler M platformrear-drive, as well asDodge Omnisfront wheel drive cars, in AMC'sKenosha, Wisconsinplant. In 1987, Chrysler acquired the 47% ownership of AMC that was held byRenault. The remaining outstanding shares of AMC were purchased on the NYSE by August 5, 1987, making the deal valued somewhere between US$1.7 billion and US$2 billion, depending on how costs were counted.cite bookhttp://books.google.com/books?id117Jeep Color HistorySteveStathamMBI Publishing2002978-0-7603-0636-9April 28, 2012Chrysler CEOLee Iacoccawanted the Jeep brand, particularly theJeep Grand Cherokee (ZJ)that was under development, the world-class, brand-new manufacturing plant inBramalea, Ontario, as well as AMC's engineering and management talent that became critical for Chrysler's future success.cite journalhttp://wardsautoworld.com/ar/auto_daimlerchrysler_ifs/index.htmlDaimlerChrysler: The 'What Ifs?'Ward's AutoWorldJune 1, 1998April 1, 2014Chrysler established theJeep-EagleJeep/Eagle divisionas a "specialty" arm to market products distinctly different from theChrysler K platformK-car-basedproducts with theEagle (automobile)Eaglecars targeting import buyers.cite webhttp://www.allpar.com/history/eagle.htmlMinickDanA Brief History of Eagleallpar.comApril 1, 2014Former AMCCar dealershipdealerssoldJeepvehicles and various new Eagle models, as well as Chrysler products, strengthening the automaker's retail distribution system.

In 1998, Chrysler and its subsidiaries entered into a partnership dubbed a "merger of equals" with German-basedDaimler-BenzAG, creating the combined entityDaimlerChrysler AG.cite webhttp://www.jbcarpages.com/chrysler/history/Chrysler HistoryJB car pagesSeptember 22, 2008To the surprise of many stockholders, Daimler subsequently acquired Chrysler in a stock swap,cite newshttp://www.nytimes.com/1998/06/09/business/company-news-daimler-benz-and-chrysler-revise-ratio-for-stock-swap.htmlCompany News; Daimler-Benz and Chrysler Revise Ratio for Stock SwapJune 9, 1998The New York TimesMarch 6, 2014before the retirement of Chrysler CEO Bob Eaton. His lack of planning for Chrysler in the 1990s, to become their own global automotive company, is widely accepted as the reason why the merger was needed. Under DaimlerChrysler, the company was named DaimlerChrysler Motors Company LLC, with its U.S. operations generally called "DCX". The Eagle brand was retired shortly after Chrysler's merger with Daimler-Benz in 1998cite newshttp://articles.chicagotribune.com/1997-09-30/business/9709300310_1_eagle-sales-chrysler-corp-chrysler-and-jeep-vehiclesChrysler Discontinues Eagle BrandJacquelineFitzgeraldThe Chicago Tribune30 September 1997April 1, 2014Jeep became a stand-alone division, and efforts were made to merge the Chrysler and Jeep brands as one sales unit.cite journalBrownHaroldFranchise Dilemmas for Automobile DealersOklahoma City University Law Review199520In 2001, the Plymouth brand was also discontinued.

On May 14, 2007, DaimlerChrysler announced the sale of 80.1% of Chrysler Group to Americanprivate equityfirmCerberus Capital Management, L.P., thereafter known as Chrysler LLC, although Daimler (renamed asDaimler AG) continued to hold a 19.9% stake.cite webhttp://www.daimlerchrysler.com/dccom/0-5-7145-1-858191-1-0-0-0-0-0-11979-0-0-0-0-0-0-0-0.htmlCerberus Takes Majority Interest in Chrysler Group and Related Financial Services Business for EUR 5.5 Billion ($7.4 billion)DaimlerChrysleryeshttps://web.archive.org/20090124053942/http://daimlerchrysler.com:80/dccom/0-5-7145-1-858191-1-0-0-0-0-0-11979-0-0-0-0-0-0-0-0.html24 January 2009The economic collapse of 2007 - 2009 pushed an already fragile company to the brink. On April 30, 2009, the automaker filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection to be able to operate as a going concern, while renegotiating its debt structure and other obligations,cite journalhttp://www.forbes.com/2009/05/06/chrysler-gm-fiat-bankruptcy-opinions-columnists-nouriel-roubini.htmlNourielRoubiniThe Impact Of Chrysler's BankruptcyMay 7, 2009ForbesMarch 6, 2014which resulted in the corporation defaulting on over $4 billion in secured debts.cite webhttp://www.forbes.com/2009/05/06/chrysler-gm-fiat-bankruptcy-opinions-columnists-nouriel-roubini.htmlForbesThe Impact of Chrysler's BankruptcyMay 7, 2009RoubiniNourielhttps://web.archive.org/web/20131226210428/http://www.forbes.com/2009/05/06/chrysler-gm-fiat-bankruptcy-opinions-columnists-nouriel-roubini.htmlDecember 26, 2013The U.S. government described the company's action as a prepackaged surgical bankruptcy."

The sale of substantially all of Chrysler's assets to "New Chrysler", organized as Chrysler Group LLC was completed on June 10, 2009. The federal government provided support for the deal with US$8 billion in financing at near 21%. Under Sergio Marchionne, "World Class Manufacturing" or WCM, a system of complete and thorough manufacturing quality, was introduced and several products re-launched with quality and luxury. The 2010 Jeep Grand Cherokee very soon became the most awarded SUV - Ever. The Ram, Jeep, Dodge, SRT and Chrysler divisions were separated to focus on their own identity and brand and 11 major model refreshes occurred in 21 months. The PT Cruiser, Nitro, Liberty and Caliber models (created during DCX) were discontinued. On May 24, 2011, Chrysler repaid its $7.6 billion loans to the United States and Canadian governments.cite webhttp://pdf.secdatabase.com/2194/0001193125-11-148779.pdfChrysler, Form 8-K, Current Report, Filing Date May 24, 2011secdatabase.comMarch 25, 2013cite webhttp://www.autoblog.com/2011/05/24/chrysler-repays-the-rest-of-its-federal-loans-are-suvs-to-tha/Breaking: Chrysler repays the rest of its federal loans... are SUVs to thank?May 24, 2011autoblog.comThe US Treasury, through theTroubled Asset Release Program, invested $12.5 billion in Chrysler and recovered $11.2 billion when the company shares were sold in May 2011, resulting in a $1.3 billion loss.cite newsKimberlyAmadeoAuto Industry Bailout (GM, Ford, Chrysler)About Newshttp://useconomy.about.com/od/criticalssues/a/auto_bailout.htmJuly 20, 2015cite webhttp://money.cnn.com/2011/07/21/autos/chrysler_government_exit/index.htm?iidCNNU.S. loses $1.3 billion in exiting ChryslerNovember 23, 2014July 21, 2011AnnalynCenskyhttps://web.archive.org/web/20120509103317/http://money.cnn.com/2011/07/21/autos/chrysler_government_exit/index.htm?iidMay 9, 2012cite webhttp://www.politico.com/news/stories/0711/59582.htmlPolitico.comTreasury: Chrysler bailout cost $1.3BNovember 23, 2014July 21, 2011EliasGrollhttps://web.archive.org/web/20120312210210/http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0711/59582.htmlMarch 12, 2012cite webhttp://www.treasury.gov/initiatives/financial-stability/TARP-Programs/automotive-programs/Pages/default.aspxU.S. Department of the TreasuryAuto Industry:Program Overview - Five Year UpdateNovember 23, 2014https://web.archive.org/web/20141006204916/http://www.treasury.gov/initiatives/financial-stability/TARP-Programs/automotive-programs/Pages/default.aspxOctober 6, 2014On July 21, 2011, Fiat bought the Chrysler shares held by the United States Treasury.cite webhttp://edgar.secdatabase.com/1730/119312511193300/filing-main.htmChrysler, Form 8-K, Current Report, Filing Date Jul 21, 2011secdatabase.comMarch 25, 2013With the purchase, Chrysler once again became foreign owned; however, this time Chrysler was the luxury division. TheChrysler 300was badged Lancia Thema in some European markets (with additional engine options), giving Lancia a much needed replacement for its flagship.

On January 1, 2014, Fiat announced it would be acquiring the remaining shares of Chrysler owned by theVoluntary Employee Beneficiary AssociationVEBAworth $3.65 billion.cite newshttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/transport/10546248/Fiat-to-take-total-control-of-Chrysler-in-3.65bn-deal.htmlFiat to take total control of Chrysler in $3.65bn dealThe TelegraphJanuary 1, 2014January 1, 2014LondonThe deal was completed on January 21, 2014.Several days later, the intended reorganization of Fiat and Chrysler under a new holding company,Fiat Chrysler Automobiles, together with a new FCA logo were announced.cite webhttp://www.theautochannel.com/news/2014/01/30/101918-following-initial-phase-with-two-corporate-logos-appearing-side-by.htmlNew Fiat-Chrysler Merged LogoThe Auto ChannelJanuary 30, 2014April 1, 2014The most challenging launch for this new company came immediately in January 2014 with a completely redesignedChrysler 200. The vehicle's creation is from the completely integrated company, FCA, executing from a global compact-wide platform."motor week"Verify sourceApril 2014

On 16 December 2014, Chrysler Group LLC announced a name change to FCA US LLC.cite newshttp://www.detroitnews.com/story/business/autos/chrysler/2014/12/16/chrysler-name-change-fca-us/20472137/Chrysler renamed 'FCA US LLC'December 16, 2014December 16, 2014[[The Detroit News]]WaylandMichael

article.heading: Sales and marketing
United States sales
article.paragraph: Chrysler is the smallest of the "Big Three" U.S. automakers (Chrysler Group LLC,Ford Motor Company, andGeneral Motors). In 2013 Chrysler sold 1,800,368 vehicles, 9% up from 2012, and fourth largest in sales behind GM, Ford and Toyota.cite webHere Are The December 2013 'Big Eight' US Auto Sales Numbershttp://www.ibtimes.com/here-are-december-2013-big-eight-us-auto-sales-numbers-gm-ford-chrysler-toyota-honda-nissan-1525492International Business Times7 May 20143 January 2014

Chrysler's sales have fluctuated dramatically over the last decade. In 2007 sales reached 2,076,650,cite webChrysler LLC Reports December 2008 U.S. Saleshttp://www.media.chrysler.com/newsrelease.do?idChrysler LLC7 May 20145 January 2009falling to 931,402 units in 2009, the company's worst result in decades.

It is reported that Chrysler was heavy on fleet sales in 2010, hitting as high as 56 percent of total sales in February of that year. For the whole year, 38 percent of sales of Chrysler were to fleet customers. The industry average was 19 percent. However, the company hopes to reduce its fleet sales to the industry average in 2011 with a renewed product lineup.cite webChrysler to Bring Fleet Sales in-line with Industry AverageFebruary 15, 2011DrewJohnsonLeft Lane News
article.heading: Global sales
article.paragraph: Chrysler is the world's 11th largest vehicle manufacturer as ranked by OICA in 2012.cite webhttp://www.oica.net/wp-content/uploads/2013/03/worldpro2012-modification-ranking.pdfWorld Motor Vehicle Production – World Ranking of Manufactures 2012OICA7 May 2014Total Chrysler vehicle production was about 2.37 million that year, up from 1.58 million in 2010.
article.heading: Product recalls
Brake booster shield recall, March 2014
article.paragraph: In April 2014, Chrysler recalled brake boosters from Dodge Durango and Jeep Grand Cherokee Vehicles manufactured in the years 2011-2014 stating that, "A brake booster's center shell may corrode and allow water to get inside, which could freeze and limit the braking ability of the vehicle, increasing the risk of a crash." Chrysler is offering a free repair for any affected SUV worldwide, all that is required is the drive to a local dealer for the repair.
article.heading: Marketing
Lifetime powertrain warranty
article.paragraph: In 2007, Chrysler began to offer vehicle lifetime powertrain warranty for the first registered owner or retail lessee.cite webAbuelsamidSamhttp://www.autoblog.com/2007/07/26/breaking-chrysler-announces-lifetime-powertrain-warranty/Breaking: Chrysler announces lifetime powertrain warranty!Autoblog.comJuly 26, 2007July 11, 2010The deal covered owner or lessee in U.S., Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands, for 2009 model year vehicles, and 2006, 2007 and 2008 model year vehicles purchased on or after July 26, 2007. Covered vehicles excluded SRT models, Diesel vehicles, Sprinter models, Ram Chassis Cab, Hybrid System components (including transmission), and certain fleet vehicles. The warranty is non-transferable.cite webhttp://www.chrysler.com/en/lifetime_powertrain_warranty/faq.htmlNew Chrysler Lifetime Powertrain Warranty Customers – Q&AChrysler.comJuly 26, 2007July 11, 2010After Chrysler's restructuring, the warranty program was replaced by five-year/100,000 mile transferrable warranty for 2010 or later vehicles.cite webKorzeniewskiJeremyhttp://www.autoblog.com/2009/08/20/report-chrysler-dropping-lifetime-powertrain-warranty-to-5-year/REPORT: Chrysler dropping lifetime powertrain warranty to five-year/100,000 milesAutoblog.comAugust 20, 2009July 11, 2010
article.heading: "Let's Refuel America"
article.paragraph: In 2008, as a response to customer feedback citing the prospect of rising gas prices as a top concern, Chrysler launched the "Let's Refuel America" incentive campaign, which guaranteed new-car buyers a gasoline price of $2.99 for three years.cite press releasehttp://media.chrysler.com/newsrelease.do;jsessionidChrysler LLC Delivers Economic Stimulus; Protects Consumers from Rising Gas Prices for Three YearsChrysler.comMarch 7, 2012With the U.S. purchase of eligible Chrysler, Jeep and Dodge vehicles, customers could enroll in the program and receive a gas card that immediately lowers their gas price to $2.99 a gallon, and keeps it there for the three years.
article.heading: Lancia co-branding
article.paragraph: Chrysler plans forLanciato codevelop products, with some vehicles being shared. Olivier Francois, Lancia's CEO, was appointed to theChrysler (division)Chryslerdivision in October 2009. Francois plans to reestablish the Chrysler brand as an upscale brand.cite webhttp://www.leftlanenews.com/lancia-chrysler-to-share-products.htmlLancia, Chrysler to share productsLeftlanenews.comNovember 29, 2009

article.heading: "Imported From Detroit"
article.paragraph: In 2011, Chrysler unveiled their "Imported From Detroit" campaign with ads featuring Detroit rapperEminem, one of which aired during the Super Bowl. The campaign highlighted the rejuvenation of the entire product lineup, which included the new, redesigned and repackaged 2011 200 sedan and 200 convertible, the Chrysler 300 sedan and the Chrysler Town & Country minivan.cite webGutierrezDiannahttp://www.media.chrysler.com/newsrelease.do;jsessionidChrysler Brand Launches New Marketing and Advertising CampaignAutoblog.comFebruary 6, 2011April 11, 2011cite webChris Shunk RSS feedhttp://www.autoblog.com/2011/03/08/detroit-city-council-honors-chryslers-super-bowl-commercial-w/Detroit City Council honors Chrysler's Super Bowl commercialAutoblog.comMay 20, 2012As part of the campaign, Chrysler sold a line of clothing items featuring theMonument to Joe Louis, with proceeds being funneled to Detroit-area charities, including the Boys and Girls Clubs of Southeast Michigan, Habitat for Humanity Detroit and the Marshall Mathers Foundation.cite webAaron Richardson RSS feedhttp://www.autoblog.com/2011/03/14/report-chrysler-updates-imported-from-detroit-logo/Report: Chrysler updates 'Imported From Detroit' logoAutoblog.comMay 20, 2012Following the Eminem ad, there was also an ad for Detroit Lions defensive tackleNdamukong Suhdriving a Chrysler 300 to Portland, Oregon, to visit his mother, an ad featuring Detroit-born fashion designerJohn Varvatoscruising through a shadowy Gotham while Kevin Yon's familiar baritone traces the designer's genesis.cite newsSchultzJonathanhttp://wheels.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/05/12/chrysler-exports-imported-from-detroit-to-new-york/Chrysler Exports 'Imported From Detroit' to New YorkThe New York TimesMay 12, 2011May 20, 2012

In March 2011, Chrysler Group LLC filed a lawsuit against Moda Group LLC (owner of Pure Detroit clothing retailer) for copying and selling merchandise with the "Imported from Detroit" slogan.Halcom, Chad (March 16, 2011)."Chrysler sues Pure Detroit, says 'Imported From Detroit' merchandise infringes on trademark".Crain's Detroit Business. Retrieved July 18, 2012.Chrysler claimed it had notified defendant of its pending trademark application February 14, but the defendant argued Chrysler had not secured a trademark for the "Imported From Detroit" phrase. On June 18, 2011, U.S. District Judge Arthur Tarnow ruled that Chrysler's request did not show that it would suffer irreparable harm or that it had a strong likelihood of winning its case. Therefore, Pure Detroit's owner, Detroit retailer Moda Group LLC, can continue selling its "Imported from Detroit" products. Tarnow also noted that Chrysler does not have a trademark on "Imported from Detroit" and rejected the automaker's argument that trademark law is not applicable to the case.cite webhttp://www.autoweek.com/article/20110629/CARNEWS/110629852/0/videonewsarchiveChrysler loses 'Imported from Detroit' lawsuitAutoweek.comJune 29, 2011May 20, 2012cite webZachBowmanhttp://www.autoblog.com/2011/06/29/chrysler-legal-bid-to-halt-imported-from-detroit-merchandise-s/Chrysler legal bid to halt 'Imported From Detroit' merchandise sales falls shortAutoblog.comJune 29, 2011May 20, 2012In March 2012, Chrysler Group LLC and Pure Detroit agreed to a March 27 mediation to try to settle the lawsuit over the clothing company's use of "Imported from Detroit" slogan.cite webhttp://www.detroitnews.com/article/20120319/AUTO0101/203190378/1148/auto01/Chrysler-Pure-Detroit-agree-mediation-settle-Imported-from-Detroit-suitChrysler, Pure Detroit agree to mediation to settle 'Imported from Detroit' suitThe Detroit NewsMarch 19, 2012May 20, 2012yeshttps://web.archive.org/20140407072522/http://www.detroitnews.com/article/20120319/AUTO0101/203190378/1148/auto01/Chrysler-Pure-Detroit-agree-mediation-settle-Imported-from-Detroit-suit7 April 2014Pure Detroit stated that Chrysler has made false claims about the origins of three vehicles - Chrysler 200, Chrysler 300 and Chrysler Town & Country - none of which are built in Detroit. Pure Detroit also said that Chrysler's Imported From Detroit merchandise is not being made in Detroit.Citation neededJuly 2015

Chrysler'sJefferson North Assembly, which makes the Jeep Grand Cherokee and Dodge Durango, is the only car manufacturing plant of any company remaining entirely in Detroit (General Motors operates a plant which is partly in Detroit and partly in Hamtramck).cite newshttp://www.nytimes.com/2013/07/16/business/last-car-plant-brings-detroit-hope-and-cash.htmlLast Car Plant Brings Detroit Hope and CashBillVlasicJuly 15, 2013The New York TimesApril 1, 2014

In 2011, Eminem settled a lawsuit againstAudialleging the defendant had ripped off the Chrysler 300 Super Bowl commercial in theAudi A6Avant ad.cite webhttp://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/industry/publishing/audi-settles-copyright-lawsuit-with-eminem-1005306352.storyAudi Settles Copyright Lawsuit With Eminem Over 'Lose Yourself' AdWolfgangSpahrBillboardAugust 5, 2011April 29, 2012
article.heading: "Half Time in America"
article.paragraph: Again in 2012, Chrysler advertised during theSuper Bowl. Its two-minute February 5, 2012Super Bowl XLVIadvertisement was titled "Half Time in America". The ad drew criticism from several leading U.S.Conservatism in the United Statesconservatives, who suggested that its messaging implied that PresidentBarack Obamadeserved a second term and, as such, was political payback for Obama's support for the federal bailout of the company.cite newshttp://articles.cnn.com/2012-02-06/politics/politics_eastwood-ad-politics_1_chrysler-ad-halftime-show-america-auto-industry?_sBryanMonroeCNNWere politics buried inside Eastwood's 'Halftime' commercial?February 6, 2012April 29, 2012Asked about the criticism in a60 Minutesinterview withSteve Kroft, Sergio Marchionne responded "just to rectify the record I paid back the loans at 19.7% Interest. I don't think I committed to do to a commercial on top of that" and characterized theRepublican Party (United States)Republicanreaction as "unnecessary and out of place".Cite interviewSergio Marchionne: Resurrecting Chryslerhttp://www.cbsnews.com/8301-18560_162-57403925/sergio-marchionne-resurrecting-chrysler/March 25, 2012SergioMarchionneCBS News3July 30, 2012Steve Kroft60 MinutesSergio Marchionne

In 2014, Chrysler started using a new slogan, "America's Import" in ads introducing their all-new 2015 Chrysler 200, targeting foreign automakers from Germany to Japan with such ads (German performance and Japanese quality), and at the ending of selected ads, the advertisement will say, "We Built This", indicating being built in America, instead of overseas.

article.heading: Fiat
article.paragraph: In 2010, Fiat Auto was planning to sell seven of its vehicles in the U.S. by 2014, while Fiat-controlled Chrysler Group was to supply nine models to sell under Fiat brands in the European market, according to a five-year plan rolled out on April 21, 2010 inTurin, Italy, by Fiat and Chrysler CEOSergio Marchionne. At least five of the Fiat Auto models were expected to be marketed in the U.S. under itsAlfa Romeobrand. Showing the level of integration envisioned, a product introduction timeline envisaged Chrysler-built compact and full-size SUVs going on sale in 2012 and 2014, respectively, in both European and North American markets.cite newshttp://www.usatoday.com/money/advertising/2010-04-21-fiat-splits_N.htmUSA TodayJames R.Healey7 new Fiat models bound for U.S.; 9 Chryslers to go abroadApril 21, 2010
article.heading: Chrysler Uconnect
article.paragraph: First introduced as MyGig,Chrysler Uconnectis a system that brings interactive ability to the in-car radio and telemetric-like controls to car settings.cite webhttp://www.allpar.com/history/chrysler-years/2009.html2009 Chryslers, Dodges, and Jeeps: "Official" ChangesallparApril 1, 2014As of mid-2015, it is installed in hundreds of thousands of Fiat Chrysler vehicles.Cite webHackers Remotely Kill a Jeep on the Highway—With Me in Ithttp://www.wired.com/2015/07/hackers-remotely-kill-jeep-highway/2015-07-22[[Wired (website)|Wired]]GreenbergAndyIt connects to the Internet via the mobile network ofSprint CorporationSprint, providing the car with its own IP address.Internet connectivity using any Chrysler, Dodge, Jeep or Ram vehicle, via a Wi-Fi "hot-spot", is also available viaChrysler Uconnect WebUconnect Web. According to Chrysler LLC, the hotspot range extends approximatelyconvert100ftmfrom the vehicle in all directions, and combines both Wi-Fi andSprint CorporationSprint's 3Gcellular connectivity.Citation neededJuly 2015Uconnect is available on several currentWhenJuly 2015and was available on several discontinued Chrysler models including the current Dodge Dart,Chrysler 300,Chrysler AspenAspen,Chrysler SebringSebring,Chrysler Town and CountryTown and Country,Dodge Avenger,Dodge CaliberCaliber,Dodge CaravanGrand Caravan,Dodge ChallengerChallenger,Dodge Charger (LX)Charger,Dodge JourneyJourney,Dodge NitroNitro, andDodge RamRam.cite webDaviesChrisJune 26, 2008http://www.slashgear.com/chrysler-uconnect-web-turns-car-into-wifi-hotspot-2612280/Chrysler uconnect Web turns car into WiFi hotspotSlashGearApril 1, 2014

In July 2015, IT security researchers announced a severe security flaw assumed to affect every Chrysler vehicle with Uconnect produced from late 2013 to early 2015.It allows hackers to gain access to the car over the Internet, and in the case of aJeep Cherokee (KL)Jeep Cherokeewas demonstrated to enable an attacker to take control not just of the radio, A/C, and windshield wipers, but also of the car's steering, brakes andTransmission (mechanics)transmission.Chrysler published aPatch (computing)patchthat car owners can download and install via a USB stick, or have a car dealer install for them.

article.heading: Controversies
article.paragraph: In 1973 Chrysler along withFord Motor Company,General Motors,Toyota, andVolkswagenhad to remove ambient temperature switches which affected emissions, though the companies denied intentional cheating and said that strategies like enriching fuel mixture during cold engine warm-up periods could reduce overall pollution.CitationAuto makers and EPA split victories on '73 vehicles[[Chronicle-Telegram]]22 January 1973{{Subscription required|viaCitationDefeat Devices Must Go[[United Press International]][[The News Herald (Panama City)]]23 January 1973{{Subscription required|viaCitationhttp://autoweek.com/article/car-news/vw-emissions-defeat-device-isnt-firstVW emissions 'defeat device' isn't the first24 September 2015[[AutoWeek]]26 September 2015The switches were ordered removed from production but cars already on the road did not have to be recalled, and fines were relatively modest.
article.heading: Special programs
article.paragraph: DuringWorld War II, essentially all of Chrysler's facilities were devoted to building military vehicles (theJeepbrand came later, after Chrysler acquiredAmerican Motors Corporation).cite bookhttp://books.google.com/books?id192The Birth of Chrysler Corporation and Its Engineering LegacyCarlBreerAnthony J.Yanik1992SAE International978-1-56091-524-9April 28, 2012They were also designing V12 and V16 hemi-engines producingconvert2500hpkW PS0onfor airplanes, but they did not make it into production asjet enginejetswere developed and were seen as the future for air travel.cite webhttp://www.allpar.com/mopar/hemi/chrysler-hemi.htmlThe Original Chrysler Hemi EngineAllpar.comApril 28, 2012During the 1950sCold Warperiod, Chrysler madeChrysler air raid sirenair raid sirenspowered by its Hemi V-8 engines.
article.heading: Radar antennas
article.paragraph: When theRadiation LaboratoryatMassachusetts Institute of TechnologyMITwas established in 1941 to developmicrowaveradars, one of the first projects resulted in theSCR-584, the most widely recognized radar system of the war era. This system included aparabolic antennasix feet in diameter that was mechanically aimed in a helical pattern (round and round as well as up and down).

One of Chryslers most significant contributions to the war effort was not in the field of vehicles but in the radar field. For the final production design of this antenna and its highly complex drive mechanism, the ArmysSignal Corps Laboratoriesturned to Chrysler's Central Engineering Office. There, the parabola was changed from aluminum to steel, allowing production forming using standard automotive presses. To keep weight down, 6,000 equally spaced holes were drilled in the face (this had no effect on the radiation pattern). The drive mechanism was completely redesigned, using technology derived from Chryslers research in automotive gears and differentials. The changes resulted in improved performance, reduced weight, and easier maintenance. A large portion of the Dodge plant was used in building 1,500 of the SCR-584 antennas as well as the vans used in the systems.cite bookStoutWesley W.The Great DetectiveChrysler Corporation1946citationColtonRoger B.Radar in the United States ArmyProceedings of the I.R.E.33740–7531947http://cecom.army.mil/historian/docdisp.php?fnameApril 28, 2012
article.heading: Aircraft
Missiles
article.paragraph: In April 1950, the U.S. Army established the Ordnance Guided Missile Center (OGMC) atRedstone Arsenal, adjacent toHuntsville, Alabama. To form OGMC, over 1,000 civilian and military personnel were transferred fromFort Bliss, Texas. Included was a group of German scientists and engineers led byWernher von Braun; this group had been brought to America underProject Paperclip. OGMC designed the Army's firstshort-range ballistic missile, thePGM-11 Redstone, based on the WWII GermanV-2missile. Chrysler established the Missile Division to serve as the Redstone prime contractor, setting up an engineering operation in Huntsville and for production obtaining use from the U.S. Navy of a large plant inWarren, Michigan. The Redstone was in active service from 1958 to 1964; it was also the first missile to test-launch a livenuclear weapon, first detonated in a 1958 test in the South Pacific.Bullard, John W.; History Of The Redstone Missile System, Historical Monograph Project Number: AMC 23 M. Historical Division, Army Missile Command

Working together, the Missile Division and von Braun's team greatly increased the capability of the Redstone, resulting in thePGM-19 Jupiter, amedium-range ballistic missile. In May 1959, a Jupiter missile launched two small monkeys into space in anose cone; this was America's first successful flight and recovery of live space payloads. Responsibility for deploying Jupiter missiles was transferred from the Army to the Air Force; armed withnuclear warheads, they were first deployed inItalyandTurkeyduring the early 1960s.cite webFact Sheet: Chrysler SM-78/PGM-19 JupiterNational Museum of the U.S. Air Forcehttp://www.nationalmuseum.af.mil/factsheets/factsheet.asp?idMay 14, 2009April 1, 2014
article.heading: Space boosters
article.paragraph: In July 1959,NASAchose theRedstone missileas the basis for theMercury-Redstone Launch Vehicleto be used for suborbital test flights of theProject Mercuryspacecraft. Three unmanned MRLV launch attempts were made between November 1960 and March 1961, two of which were successful. The MRLV successfully launched the chimpanzeeHam the ChimpHam, and astronautsAlan ShepardandGus Grissomon three suborbital flights in January, May and July 1961, respectively.

America's more ambitious manned space travel plans included the design of theSaturn (rocket family)Saturn seriesof heavy-lift launch vehicles by a team headed byWernher von Braun. Chrysler's Huntsville operation, then designated the Space Division, becameMarshall Space Flight Centers prime contractor for the first stage of theSaturn IandSaturn IBversions. The design was based on a cluster of Redstone andPGM-19 JupiterJupiterfuel tanks, and Chrysler built it for theApollo programin theMichoud Assembly Facilityin East New Orleans, one of the largest manufacturing plants in the world. Between October 1961 and July 1975, NASA used ten Saturn Is and nine Saturn IBs for suborbital and orbital flights, all of which were successful;Bilstein, Roger E.;''Stages to Saturn: A Technological History of the Apollo/Saturn Launch Vehicles''. NASA SP-4206, 1980, ISBN 0-16-048909-1.Page neededAugust 2012Chrysler missiles and boosters never suffered a launch failure.Citation neededAugust 2012The division was also a subcontractor which modified one of theMobile Launcher Platformsfor use with the Saturn IB rockets using Saturn V infrastructure.
